headline: Garlic Shrimp Linguine
description: This shrimp linguine dish is a deceptively simple sauté of butter, garlic, wine, Parmesan cheese, and shrimp served over hot linguine with parsley.

video.description: Make elegant but easy garlic shrimp in a white wine and butter sauce.
video.name: Garlic Shrimp Linguine

name: Garlic Shrimp Linguine
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for serving
1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley, plus more for garnish
1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook linguine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes. Drain.
Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add wine, garlic, Parmesan cheese, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer, stirring frequently, over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes.
Increase heat to medium-high and add shrimp to the saucepan; cook until shrimp begins to turn pink, 3 to 4 minutes. Do not overcook.
Divide pasta into 8 bowls. Spoon shrimp with sauce on top. Garnish with Parmesan cheese and parsley.

review.reviewBody: Super delicious! Used lemon garlic linguine. With others' advice, I adjusted the ratio = doubled the butter & wine and less pasta, added basil. Also added cheese AFTER noodles & shrimp were added. Yum!
The ratio of Pasta to sauce is completely off. Triple the ingredients for the sauce if your using 1 lb. of pasta. The sauce was alright. Not what I was expecting.

I love easy recipes that turn into something delicious. I doubled the ingredients for 1/2 lb. of pasta as a reviewer suggested to make more sauce, but it was still slightly dry. Next time I will add a bit of the hot pasta water to make it more saucy. I used large prawns with the tail on and lots of fresh premade chopped garlic. Other than that, this dish taste as good as some I have had in fancy restaurants

I made this and it was quick, easy and delicious! The ingredients are simple and combine nicely. Being from Louisiana, I seasoned the shrimp with a little Tony Chachere’s Seasoning Salt. I also added a little fresh lemon juice. Thanks for this great recipe.
Not at all tasty. Very bland. No where near enough sauce. Needs a lot of work to get an eatable entrée .
Perfect with a side of greens.
Followed to the T, and it did not disappoint! Simple and tasty. Hubby told me I'd knocked it out of the park so... Must have been a good one!
It was a fast delicious meal. I added 2 tbsp of olive oil before adding the pasta. Stirred then added pasta and stirred again. Before serving, I added a little butter to taste. My husband loved it.
Yes, I doubled the ingredients in the sayce
Delicious
Great! However hold the Parmesan til serving. Much better than gluey sauce!
This recipe is too bland for me.
Made this a couple times according to the recipe. Good but a little bland. Will work with this and do something to amp up the flavor. Maybe pepper flakes or lemon to brighten it up.
Although I never had shrimp, in my family we eat them with rice, but after looking at these pictures, I will try it when get the chance. Dubai Tires
I tried this recipe and it was so easy to make and tasted great. The whole family loved it!!

We loved it, served with a side of broccoli. Did have to make a few tweaks. Since there is only 2 of us, I scaled the recipe down to 2 servings, and only used 1/4 lb pasta & shrimp. I also used 1-1/2 teaspoons of minced garlic (from a jar). The rest of the ingredients I used 4-5 times more than the recipe called for. Next time I think I will add some baby spinach and mushrooms.
Recipe needs to be doubled in order to have enough sauce

Tasted amazing. Though if you like saucy noodles I recommend doubling or tripling the recipe. I enjoyed it as a lighter pasta. I substituted fish for the shrimp and pan fried it first, cooking the sauce in the pan after. I used angel hair instead of linguine as well as I’m trying to eat better. For those trying to transition to eating better but love their pasta this is a great recipe to help with that transition as there are many ways to modify and add twists such as veggies or other noodles and proteins.

Restaurant Quality ! Will make again next wk.. Just made the garlic shrimp pasta, with someone's reccomendation to change sauce: drizzle olive oil, 4 cloves garlic(chopped), 3/4C white wine, 1 & 1/2 sticks margarine, 1C half&half, 1/4 tsp salt/pepper/red pepper spice, 1tsp basil/oregano, i added 1C frozen chopped spinich(can add any favorite Vegie). Low heat until better is melted. Add 12oz package of thawed-RAW shelled, tail off shrimp, cook medium heat 4-min. 3C uncooked rotini into boiling water(8min). Drain & throw into sauce, mixing-in 1/2C parmesan(grated).. Makes 4 servings(unless your like me & want a double serving)?? I give it 5-stars.

I followed the instructions of the other reviewers and trippled the ingredients for the sauce. Also, i added a bit of olive oil and added the cheese to the ready dish instead of the sauce. I made the mistake and tossed still half-frozen shrimps into the sauce so it got too watery. I fished the shrimps out after they were done cooking and added a water-cornstarch solution to thicken the sauce. I guess this could be done anyways if someone likes their sauces on the thicker side. it was super delicious and will definitely make again!

Very good flavors! As others noted, I added the parmesan at the end. I also sautéed 1/4 cup onions in olive oil first then added wine (1 cup) , garlic, parsley, salt & pepper and let it reduced a little before adding shrimp to cook fully, then Parmesan just before serving.
I added more white wine, butter and 1/2 cup of clam juice and then reduced it for a thicker sauce.
With more wine, garlic and butter it was great!
very good. I think a little milk and double the wine measurement and perfect

This was easy, but really suffered from a lack of flavor. The amounts of butter, wine, etc. are not nearly enough to make a "sauce" for one pound of pasta, I had to add extra just to get the pasta wet. Edible, but I won't make it again.
Followed other's suggestions and increased butter, wine, spices and added mushrooms and a little bit of chili flakes

It was great! Simple and fast. Luved it! The only thing I changed was following someone else's advice and doubled the sauce portions. My family and I like a lot of sauce. Thanks for this quick dinner saver!

I did as others suggested - I halved the pasta, doubled the sauce, added mushrooms, and added spinach when I put the shrimp in. We really enjoyed it, but my husband asked me next time to increase the sauce, so I guess I'll triple it. The sauce is so good. Next time I think I will also increase the shrimp. They seemed to get kind of lost in all the pasta.

I love this easy recipe! Thank you for sharing this wonderful & most delicious recipe StaceyO! Also, thank you to the reviewers for their suggestions. I did increase the butter by a tablespoon, used Asiago cheese instead, added a teaspoon of basil & a teaspoon of crushed red pepper flakes. Also, I used 1 1/2 teaspoons of Chicken stock base to the sauce. Everyone in my family absolutely loved this dish! They are begging me to make this again! I will make this dish again and again and again!
It was delicious! I added a few tablespoons of homemade pesto. I will definitely make this again and again!
It was delicious , low calorie and easy to prepare. My only problem was I should have tripled the amount of sauce.
The garlic shrimp linguine was great. I have made it a few times lately and it is always great. The only thing I changed was I used zuccini instead of linguine.
This was good and will make it again. It was nice and quick.
Simple, fast and delicious! Dinner was done in under 10 minutes. Love it!
Not enough garlic and no evoo! Bland tasting and needed more parmesan cheese.
OMG delicious
Wish I had read the reviews before I made it. The ingredients listed weren't nearly enough for the 1 lb bag of pasta!!! I saw some great comments about what to add that I will use next time.
I added some garlic polish sausage and red dragon cayanne pepper flakes for a bit of spice. SOOOO good.
I agree with others, don’t add the cheese until the end. It get all gooey and double the amounts of liquid.
Made this yesterday for Dinner and my husband and kids loved it! I added lemon juice to the sauce and it was yummy. Thanks for the recipe, I will definitely make this again.
Very good. I added spinach and made much more of the sauce as suggested by other reviewers. Tossed the pasta in with the shrimp/garlic mixture for a few minutes to enhance the flavors.
I've made this dish a couple of times and it is delicious!!! My wife and I make this together as date night meal and it's easy and fun to make. The meal itself is very very good
Loved it! I'll make it again!
I tripled the sauce (only 1 extra garlic clove though). So delicious, I could have gotten by with just doubling the sauce. So quick, easy and healthy too!
great ratio of sauce ingredients, but needed more for a pound of shrimp. would definitely make again but scale up the sauce.

I followed all the comments and doubled the sauce (butter, wine, parm) and added 1 TBS of olive oil. I also added 1/2 pound mushrooms, a handful of cherry tomato halves, and about 3 oz fresh spinach. Seems like pretty much anything could be added for extra flavor, color, and nutrition. Like someone else said, a good starter recipe. Have fun and be creative!
This was great! The teenager even liked it! We made 3 times the sauce and used about a tablespoon more of garlic.
I doubled the sauce as suggested, easy, quick, yummy. It was great for a fast dinner.
loved it! added a bit more butter and wine :)

I made it and doubled the butter garlic sauce and did as the video said, mixing the linguine back into the butter, garlic and Shrimp pan to warm the linguini and it was very dry.
Next time I will mix the pasta with extra virgin olive oil and make triple the sauce and leave it on the side to spoon over as it’s plated. I think I will also add some cherry tomatoes for a little added flavor.

This was such a quick and easy meal to make. I am by no means a great cook but this dish made me feel like I was. I didn't have garlic so I had to use garlic salt and garlic powder but still very tasty.
Very tasty but needed more sauce
It was delicious I added a little more to the recipes I added more wine and extra shrimp. It was delicious and my friends loved it. It is definitely a do-over.
This is a great recipe. I didn’t have parsley but I did have some shallot so I used that and it came out great.
I made this as per many reviewers comments. So good!
This was delicious, I cannot wait to eat the left overs tomorrow.

Yummy!! Hubby just said “don’t loose this recipe”. This one is so easy to prepare. I omitted the linguine so there was only one pot! We like to have extra sauce for dipping so I amped up the butter, Parmesan and wine and added a little olive oil to begin with and a dusting of seasoned bread crumbs and a squeeze of lemon to finish it. Along with thick slices of Ciabbata bread( it stays fresh much longer than a French loaf) and a side of Asian slaw and of course it included a glass of white wine. The entire meal for two was less than an entree at a local restaurant would have been. Medium shrimp was on sale for $9.99 a lb, (28-30 per lb), everything else was in the pantry, wine was bogo, so was the slaw and there are leftovers for lunch tomorrow. Living on the Gulf Coast we enjoy a lot of seafood and this was a real winner!!
Turned out better than I had expected, seems like a very simple dish but turns out so delicious, and make people think it took a very long time.
As others have said there's not enough sauce so I doubled the recipe. My husband and I enjoyed this very much but I would make even more sauce next time
Very good but parm melted and clumped so very had to use romano.
Love the recipe for its simplicity and fabulous taste. Thank you for sharing the recipe!
this dish was very good. made alittle more butter mixture for linguine.
Great date night dish! Thanks for this recipe.
It's a great recipe ! I missed out on white wine and the veggies but it still tasted amazing and everyone loved it! It's simple to cook as well.

Wow! What a great sauce, after adjusting the quantities on all ingredients as recommended by others, this turned out amazing! I also added fresh spinach to the sauce at the end just after turning the shrimp.
Great recipe customizable to personal tastes. I upped the seasoning, wine, butter etc and everyone was very pleased.

When I read the recipe I knew that I needed to increase the sauce ingredients, so I did. This was very tasty, and we all loved it. I'll definitely make it again. BTW, the author of this dish is a very accommodating host! Drop-in (uninvited) guests don't get a 'gourmet-type' meal here! Cheese & crackers w/a glass of wine, OR cake & coffee. Sorry :-(
Fantastic recipe, will definitely make it again but as others have said had to triple the ingredients.
Delicious. Don’t change a thing with this recipe.
I did not have wine so I used chicken broth. I did use more butter, combined with olive oil. My husband give it thumbs up.
Instead of white wine used more olive oil cause I didn’t have wine
added more butter. also sliced mushrooms
Added spinach as suggested. Put 3 tbsp cream, paremesan, butter & salt, pepper in the linguine. Sauted shrimp with garlic & finely chopped red onion in olive oil. Delicious!
Just put in a lengthy rating, then couldn't find it to finish. Maybe I will finish too
Very good it was easy quick and everyone loved it.
used 1 1/2 sticks of butter, 3/4 cup white wine, added a cup of scallops and some basil and oregano too, lots of garlic and just garnished with the cheese plenty
Wonderful recipe. My son, who doesn't usually eat seafood, tried it. He said it was really good!

This is a great recipe! I have made it a couple of times and tweaked it just slightly for my family. I doubled the butter and added 2 Tbsp of olive oil, used a half cup of white wine, approximately 4 tsp of parmesan cheese, 6 cloves of garlic to make it more about the garlic than the cheese. After I cooked the shrimp, I added the pasta to the pan and mixed well. Here I increased the fresh parsley to about a quarter cup and tossed everything together and served. Next time I will add some veggies, maybe mushrooms or snow peas.

Works great both on its own and as a base with other ingredients added (I added spinach and mushrooms.) If you're cooking single as I do, this dish does the rare kindness of being well balanced with its noodles and meat and gives about two days of leftovers.
I tripled the ingredients and used half the amount of pasta. Came out perfect!
Great taste. I doubled the sauce
So easy! Used chili pepper flakes rather than pepper. Will make more sauce next time.
Made it just as it said - delicious! Liked by all.
Not much favor
I loved this recipe. The flavors blend beautifully giving a rich and yummy taste to this simple weekday dinner!
Great with recommended changes. Threw everything in the instapot - manual setting for 2 minutes + quick release. Cooked perfectly
No changes
Tammy is a freak over shrimp so I made this for her tonight. Very good. Needed a bit more Garlic, and a bit more shrimp in it. Overall it was a hit.
I doubled the sauce ingredients and added fresh spinach. Turned out great!

I followed this recipe exactly... the shrimp tasted plain and unseasoned. The sauce was super thin which made it run through the pasta. I was left with wet noodles and wet shrimp in a puddle of “sauce”.
I used 1 lb. shrimp with 8 oz. pasta.

Some good stuff here! It was a 5 after I tripled the sauce ingredients after reading the numerous reviews that advised tripling or quadrupling the sauce. I did not add cream or thickeners--the garlic/white wine combo was good enough for us. It soaked into the pasta raising its flavor up several notches. I did use 1 pound of pasta as called for. And I did add a carton of baby spinach as suggested by the editors to this page--the added green made it so pretty and supplied some extra nutition as well. Wonderful presentation--restaurant quality!

I made this a few times. Previous I did as the video and put the pasta in the sauce and attempted mixing. It absorbed all sauce and like most said I was adding butter, adding butter. This time I plated the pasta, shrimp on top, and drizzled the butter/garlic/wine sauce over. Big difference and a much nicer presentation. I did add a little extra butter and splash over on wine based on what I thought would fit the drizzle on the pasta, but nothing even close to what I was doing when mixing pasta into the sauce pan. Drizzle is the way to go.

All the 4 and even 5 star reviews are from those who totally had to tweak the recipe. It was okay--even with the extra butter, wine, and garlic added, and waiting to add the cheese until the end. The initial recipe should really get 2 stars.

I made this tonight and it was very good. I did change it up by using more butter, olive oil and wine. I also used a can of white clam sauce so technically, i guess it’s Linguine and clam sauce with shrimp but the sauce was a perfect consistency. I did not add the cheese into the sauce just sprinkled on top. Also forgot the lemon but I didn’t miss it. Tasted just like my mom’s.

This dish was SO easy and fast and tasted absolutely amazing!!
I added a couple handfuls of spinach to the pot of pasta last minute of boiling, with a nice glass of Chardonnay(or two) :) Definitely would make it again
Everyone who tastes this dish raves about it...
So easy to prep and delicious. Will do again
This was delicious, doubled the sauce, poured over linguini..Perfect recipe!
